name: Al-Arqam Islamic School
mission: TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE MUSLIM CHILDREN LIVING WITHIN THE GREATER SACRAMENTO AREA.
theoryOfChange: Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory has published "Schoolwide Learning Outcomes (SLOs)" or "Student Learning Goals (SLGs)" that serve as a strategic framework. These goals are focused on establishing strong, cohesive, and engaging school programs designed to impact students academically, spiritually, socially, and physically. The school's updated SLOs are conveyed through the acrostic TORCH. The Student Learning Goals include five key areas: to live Islam, become lifelong learners, be effective communicators, be citizens of the world, and honor themselves physically and spiritually.
zakatClaimEvidence: The donation page for Al-Arqam Islamic School (Sacramento, CA, USA) provides options for checks, PayPal, and Zelle donations but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or dedicated zakat funds.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 24/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis

components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School shows strong impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The donation page for Al-Arqam Islamic School (Sacramento, CA, USA) provides options for checks, PayPal, and Zelle donations but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or dedicated zakat funds.

all_citations.claim: Al-Arqam Islamic School is a non-profit organization serving the Greater Sacramento area with specific financial metrics including working capital.
The organization reported total revenue of $4,155,519 and maintains a program expense ratio of 98.1%.
The school offers an International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program and college preparatory academics.
The school maintains formal administrative procedures to support its educational programs and student attendance.
The institution operates under a student honor code and parent policy handbook to ensure alignment with Islamic values.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 60/100 score due to its excellent internal financial efficiency and program focus, though its overall rating is tempered by low data confidence and limited external verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public data availability resulting in a low data confidence score
Need for increased transparency regarding long-term impact metrics and beneficiary outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows moderate alignment with a focus on global education urgency, though it currently has a low fit for general Muslim donors due to its localized scope and specific sadaqah-eligible status [1][5]. Its track record is established through formal academic policies and a structured honor code for students [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The school demonstrates high capacity-building impact by maintaining a 98.1% program expense ratio and offering specialized tracks like the IB Diploma Program [2][3]. While financial health is robust with $4,155,519 in total revenue and 9.1 months of working capital, the lack of cost-per-beneficiary data limits a full effectiveness assessment [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Al-Arqam Islamic School provides a rigorous college preparatory and International Baccalaureate education to Muslim youth in the Greater Sacramento area.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.1%, indicating nearly all funds directly support educational services
High financial stability with 9.1 months of working capital available
Zero-cost fundraising efficiency, maximizing the impact of every dollar donated
baseline_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School is a dedicated educational institution focused on meeting the academic and spiritual needs of Muslim children through a comprehensive college preparatory curriculum [1][3]. The school is distinguished by its International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program and a commitment to high academic standards guided by an Islamic honor code [4][5].
